summary:
This document outlines a comprehensive Personal Power Loan Agreement between Axis Bank Ltd. and Poyyar Dass S, originating from the Asset Sales Centre (ASC) Madurai. The agreement details a sanctioned loan amount of Rs. 20,00,000 with a fixed interest rate of 10.49% per annum over a tenure of 84 months, resulting in an Equated Monthly Installment (EMI) of Rs. 33,711. The applicant, Poyyar Dass S, has provided communication and permanent addresses in Tirunelveli, India, and is employed by WSP CONSULTANTS INDIA PRIVATE LIMITED.

The agreement includes an acknowledgement form where the borrower confirms understanding and agreement with the provided information, including a non-refundable processing fee of Rs. 8,259. It specifies various charges such as cheque bounce charges (rate prevailing on date of default + taxes), and detailed foreclosure/part payment charges. Foreclosure charges are 3% + GST for up to 36 EMIs and 2% + GST thereafter, with an important exemption: no foreclosure charges apply after 12 EMIs for loans of Rs. 10 lakhs or more if foreclosed from the customer's own funds, though part payment charges remain applicable for such loan sizes. Interest on the loan accrues from the date of disbursal, with the first EMI calculated based on the actual number of days remaining until its due date.

Key legal provisions cover the bank's rights, including the ability to revise repayment terms, amend conditions, disclose borrower information to various entities (including credit rating agencies and RBI), and appropriate employer dues in case of employment cessation. Borrower obligations include providing accurate information, ensuring the loan's purpose is fulfilled, prompt repayment, and notifying the bank of any changes in address or employment. The document also clearly defines events of default, such as failure to make timely payments or breach of agreement terms, which can lead to the immediate recall of the loan. Furthermore, it details the classification of accounts into Special Mention Accounts (SMA) and Non-Performing Assets (NPA) based on overdue periods, in accordance with RBI guidelines, and includes an arbitration clause for dispute resolution, with specific jurisdictions for high-value disputes.

Additional clauses cover miscellaneous aspects like the bank's right to call for additional security, the appropriation order of payments, and the governing law and jurisdiction. The agreement also includes a Demand Promissory Note for Rs. 20,00,000 and a Post-Dated Cheques Covering Letter, reinforcing the borrower's commitment to repayment and acknowledging the bank's right to use these instruments.

clauses.text_en: I/We have been provided the following information and I/We have read and understood the following information and agree with the same and have accordingly filled up the aforesaid application form.

No Foreclosure charges will be applicable after 12 EMIs for loan amount greater than or equal to 10 lakhs if the same is foreclosed from customer's own funds. However, part payment charges will be applicable for greater than or equal to 10 lakh loan ticket size.
Axis Bank is entitled to add, to delete, recall the facility in event of default without any notice or modify any of the aforesaid terms and conditions and the same shall be binding on me/us.

Interest on the Personal Power loan shall accrue from the date on which the disbursal has been effected in the loan account and accordingly the computation of the first EMI shall be calculated only for the actual number of days remaining for the due date of first installment.

No notice, reminder or intimation will be given to the Borrower regarding his/her obligation to pay the EMI regularly on each due date. It shall entirely be his/her responsibility to ensure prompt and timely payment to the Bank.

The Bank shall... be entitled to disclose any information about the Borrower, his/her account relationship with the Bank and/or any default committed by him (whether such information is provided by the Borrower or obtained by the Bank itself and whether in form of repayment conduct, rating or defaults) to its head office, other branch offices, affiliated entities, Reserve Bank of India, any Refinancing agency, credit rating agency and such third parties as the Bank may in its sole and exclusive discretion, deem fit and proper.

The Bank may by a written notice to the Borrower, declare all sums outstanding under the Personal Power Loan (including the principal, interest, charges, expenses) to become due and payable forthwith and enforce the security (if applicable) in relation to the Personal Power Loan upon the occurrence (in the sole decision of the Bank) of any one or more of the following: The Borrower fails to pay to the Bank any amount when due and payable under this Agreement.

Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this contract, including its construction, interpretation, scope, operation, effect, or validity (collectively, the 'Dispute'), shall be finally resolved through arbitration administered by a single independent arbitral institution ('Independent Institution') in accordance with its applicable rules ('Institution's Rules').

matched_rules.rule: Consumer Protection Act (relevant sections on unfair contract terms)
matched_rules.reason: This clause allows Axis Bank to unilaterally modify or terminate the agreement without notice in case of default.  Many consumer protection acts contain provisions against unfair contract terms, which often include clauses that lack transparency, provide excessive power to one party, and lack reasonable notice periods. This clause potentially violates such provisions by granting the bank excessive power and omitting a reasonable notice period before modification or termination.

matched_rules.rule: Banking Regulations (relevant sections on contract terms and disclosure)
matched_rules.reason: Banking regulations often require clear and transparent contract terms, including provisions for modification or termination. While banks generally have rights to modify contracts under certain circumstances, the absence of a notice requirement and the potentially broad scope of unilateral modification in this clause could be problematic.  Specific regulations will vary by jurisdiction, but the clause needs to be checked against the exact requirements for notification and reasonable modifications.

verification_results.final_reason: The clause is likely non-compliant because it grants Axis Bank excessive power to modify or terminate the agreement without any notice. This violates principles of fairness and transparency enshrined in consumer protection and banking regulations. The lack of a reasonable notice period and the broad scope of the bank's unilateral right to modify are key concerns.  Compliance would necessitate review against specific regulations applicable to Axis Bank and the relevant jurisdiction.

matched_rules.rule: Regulation on Accurate Interest Calculation and EMI Computation
matched_rules.reason: This hypothetical rule mandates that interest should be calculated accurately from the date of disbursement and that the first EMI should reflect the actual number of days between disbursement and the due date.  The clause explicitly adheres to this principle by stating that interest accrues from the disbursement date and the first EMI calculation considers only the remaining days until the due date.

matched_rules.rule: Truth in Lending Act (TILA) -  Section 1638 (Accurate disclosure of finance charges)
matched_rules.reason: While not explicitly stated, this rule indirectly applies. TILA requires accurate disclosure of finance charges. Calculating interest from the actual disbursement date and only charging for the actual number of days until the first EMI due date contributes to accurate disclosure. The clause's approach is consistent with the spirit of accurate and transparent interest calculations, ensuring compliance with full disclosure requirements.

matched_rules.rule: General Principle of Fair Lending Practices
matched_rules.reason: The clause reflects fair lending practices by ensuring borrowers are only charged interest for the exact period they used the loan funds.  Avoiding charging interest from a date before disbursement promotes fairness and prevents potentially misleading or unfair charges.

verification_results.final_reason: The clause is compliant because it explicitly aligns with regulations requiring accurate interest calculations from the disbursement date and precise EMI calculations based on the actual number of days until the due date.  Further, it implicitly adheres to principles of fair lending and transparency required by regulations like TILA, ensuring consumers are not charged for periods they did not utilize the funds.
